a.title: Click here to visit One Call Now
Learn how One Call Now notification services can help you

td.a: Learn how One Call Now notification services can help you

div.span:
Field Families:
Today the Governor announced school will remain physically closed for the rest of the 2019-2020 school year. We have been expecting this and we are prepared for this. School work will continue as it has the last several weeks. We will continue food distribution for the next several weeks. The Governor also said it is too early to know what school looks like in the fall, but it may look different. We are working on avariety of plans for the next school year so we will be ready. Iwill keep you informed as we move forward.
We are working on plans to have students/families pick up items that have been left in the buildings. We will announce the dates, times and plans when we are ready. We will let you know...everyone will have achance to collect their items. The High School is also working on plans to have avirtual graduation ceremony. We have booked EJ Thomas at the end of June and the end of July, but it seems the possibility of large gatherings by then is very small.
I want to thank parents, families and caregivers. You all have risen to the challenge of helping your students and you are doing amazing work. Staff, you have tackled this challenge of virtual instruction and your dedication to our students shines through. It takes all of us to get through this successfully. Thank you all!!!
Dave Heflinger
Superintendent

h3.span: Contacting the Board Office During the Closure Period

span.strong: Starting on Tuesday, March 24th the Field Local Schools Board Office will be CLOSED until further notice.

div.span: Contact will be maintained by email:
Voicemails can be left at anytime by calling 330-673-2659 ext. 5002

span.div: Field Local Schools will be providing food for families in need over the next three weeks of school closure.

Please complete this form to let us know if you are in need of food during this time.You can also contact the Board Office at 330 673 2659 on Monday. March 16th, if you need food.Food will be available to those that complete the survey or call our office each week. Distributions will be on Thursdays. Food will be able to be picked up at the front of the high school between 3 p.m. and 6 p.m.
As you heard in Mr. Heflinger's message, we will be offering technology resources to our students who need them to access online instruction. Please email [emailprotected] with questions.

h3.span: Having Issues with a Chromebook or Student Log In?

div.span: Please fill out this form to report issues with a Chromebook or student login.
The process for Kindergarten Registration is still under consideration.Please fill out this form to receive an email when new information is available.

h3.span: Coronavirus (COVID-19) Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) for Ohio's Schools and Districts
Ohio Department of Health-Coronavirus Guidelines for K-12 Schools

span.img: The Ohio Department of Education has awarded Field Local Schools aMomentum Award for the 2018-19 School year. Only 48 districts across the state of Ohio earned this award based on student growth. Districts and schools must earn all As on all applicable value-added measures on the Ohio School Report Card in 2019. The four possible measures are Overall (All Students), gifted students, students in the lowest 20 percent in achievement, and students with disabilities. Schools and districts must have aleast two graded subgroups to be eligible. Click here for alist of all schools and districts receiving the Momentum Award this year.

h3.span: Coronavirus Information from the Portage County Health Department

span.div: Open enrollment applications for grades 1-12 will be accepted beginning Monday February 24, 2020 through June 15, 2020. Open enrollment applications for incoming Suffield Kindergarten will be accepted beginning Monday February 24, 2020 through Friday Sept. 11, 2020. Applications will not be accepted after the deadline of June 15, 2020. (If mailing your application, please allow time so it is received by June 15, 2020) Open Enrollment will close and no new Open Enrollment applications will be accepted during the school year. Applications for Suffield Kindergarten Open Enrollment will not be accepted after the deadline of Sept. 11, 2020. (If mailing your application, please allow time so it is received by Sept. 11, 2020) If arenewal open enrollment application is not turned in by June 15, 2020, Field Local Schools will let your home district of residence made aware that you have not applied for open enrollment for the upcoming school year.

h3.span: 2020-2021 Kindergarten Early Entrance Testing Information - Due by May 1st, 2020

span.div: All applications for Kindergarten Early Entrance must be received in the Special Services office by May 1st, 2020, if you would like your child tested by June 4th and be considered for the 2020-2021 school year. Applications may be mailed, faxed or dropped off to:

a.strong: Click here for the Early Entrance Application.

h3.span: Notice of Proposed Class Action Settlement-Ohio Dept. of Education

div.span: The parties in the Doe v. Ohio Department of Education class action have submitted aproposed settlement to the U.S. District Court for approval. The first step in the approval process of the settlement is to provide notice of the proposed settlement to affected students and their parents. Notice
Click here to access the Open Enrollment Application for the 2019-2020 school year.

h3.span: KNOW! How to Keep Kids in Focus if Divorce Occurs

span.div: Why the child-centered focus? Because as painful as separation and divorce are for the couple going through it, they can be devastating and disastrous for the children involved. National Child-Centered Divorce Awareness Month was created to alert parents about the potential effects of divorce on children, and to help protect young peoples emotional, psychological, and physical well-being.Click here for a discussion guide.
